Class UserService

java.lang.Object
com.powerbi.api.service.UserService
@Service public class UserService extends Object
Service class responsible for managing User entities. Handles operations such as retrieving, creating, and deleting users.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserService

      public UserService()

  • Method Details

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers(String searchQuery)
      Retrieves all users or users matching a search query. If a search query is provided, it filters users by email containing the query. If no search query is provided, all users are returned.
      Parameters:
      searchQuery - the search query to filter users by email (can be null or empty)
      Returns:
      a list of User entities

    • getUser

      public User getUser(String email)
      Retrieves a user by their email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      the User entity
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the user with the given email does not exist

    • getUser

      public User getUser(Long userId)
      Retrieves a user by their ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      the User entity
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the user with the given ID does not exist

    • createUser

      public User createUser(String email)
      Creates a new User with the specified email. Checks if a user with the same email already exists.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the new user
      Returns:
      the created User entity
      Throws:
      org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException - if a user with the given email already exists

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String username, Long toDeleteUserId)
      Deletes a user with the specified ID. Only users with SuperUser permissions are allowed to delete other users.
      Parameters:
      username - the user requesting the deletion
      toDeleteUserId - the ID of the user to be deleted
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.access.AccessDeniedException - if the requesting user does not have SuperUser permissions
      NoSuchElementException - if the user to be deleted does not exist
